comment.text: This translation key is used to display the phrase "Change owner" in various places throughout the application, including a dialog header and a button. Its purpose is to inform users that they can change the ownership of something. It appears on a "Delete Owner Profile Dialog" and a "Change Portal Owner Dialog".

usage.context:
disableDisabledUsers
 filter={filter}
 />
 </ModalDialog.Container>
 ) : null}
 <ModalDialog.Header>{t("Translations:OwnerChange")}</ModalDialog.Header>
 <ModalDialog.Body>
 <StyledOwnerInfo>
 <Avatar className="avatar" role="owner" source={avatar} size="big" />
 <div className="info">
 <Text className="display-name" noSelect title={displayName}>

</Text>
 </ModalDialog.Body>
 <ModalDialog.Footer>
 <Button
 key="OwnerChangeBtn"
 label={t("Translations:OwnerChange")}
 size="normal"
 scale
 primary
 onClick={this.onClick}
 />

ai_spell_check_issues.description: The translation 'Sahibi dəyiş' is a literal translation but sounds unnatural in Azerbaijani. A more natural phrasing would be 'Sahibi et' or 'Yeni sahibi ol'.

The translation "Փոխել տնօրինողին" literally translates to "Change the manager/director." While functionally close, "owner" has a slightly different nuance than manager or director. A more accurate translation might be "ափահարել սեփականատիրոջը" or a more casual alternative depending on the context.
The translation 'හිමිකරු සංශෝධනය' while technically meaning 'owner modification', is not the most natural or idiomatic way to express 'Change owner' in Sinhala. It sounds overly formal and technical.
ai_spell_check_issues.suggestion: හිමිකාරි වෙනස් කරන්න (Himikari venas karanna) - meaning 'Change ownership' or වෙනස් කරන්න හිමිකාරි (Venás karanna himikari) - meaning 'Change the owner' are more natural and common phrases.

ai_spell_check_issues.description: The Serbian (Cyrillic) translation 'Промени власника' is a literal translation of 'Change owner' but sounds unnatural in Serbian. A more natural phrasing would be 'Помени власника' or 'Смени власника'.
